info.title: Thinkific Admin API
info.description: Thinkific's public API can be used to integrate your application with your Thinkific site.

get.description: Retrieves the Bundle identified by the provided id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Bundle in the form of an integer

parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments created after the date specified.

parameters.name: query[created_before]
parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments created before the date specified.

parameters.name: query[created_on]
parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments created on the date specified.

parameters.name: query[created_on_or_after]
parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments created on or after the date specified.

parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments created on or before the date specified.

parameters.name: query[updated_after]
parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments updated after the date specified.

parameters.name: query[updated_before]
parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments updated before the date specified.

parameters.name: query[updated_on]
parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments updated on the date specified.

parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments created on or after the date specified.

parameters.name: query[updated_on_or_before]
parameters.description: Filter for only Enrollments updated on or before the date specified.

post.description: Please note that any External Orders created through the API do not appear on the orders report or dashboard in your Thinkific site. Using the External Orders endpoints will simply store the information in our database.
This endpoint will create a new transaction refund for the External Order.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: External Order ID as integer

get.description: Retrieve a list of site scripts

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page within the collection to fetch

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to be returned

post.description: Create a new Site Script

requestBody.description:
Create Site Script request body

To create Site Scripts, either the `src` or `content` attribute must be provided. Only one should be specified.

When using the `src` attribute, the top-level domain of the URL should match the top-level domain of the App URL. When using the `content` attribute, the header `HMAC-SHA256-SIGNATURE` generated using the app's secret and content must be included in the request.

Use the drop down menu to view examples with `src` or `content` attribute

value.content: console.log('Hello! This is a Site Script')
value.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
value.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

value.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
value.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

site_script.content: console.log('Hello! This is a Site Script')
site_script.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
site_script.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

site_script.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
site_script.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

site_script.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
site_script.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

put.description: Updates the Site Script specified by the provided ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Site Script in the form of a string

requestBody.description:
Update Site Script request body

When updating Site Scripts, only one of `src` or `content` should be specified.

When using the `src` attribute, the top-level domain of the URL should match the top-level domain of the app.
When using the `content` attribute, the header `HMAC-SHA256-SIGNATURE` generated using the app's secret and content must be included in the request.

Use the dropdown menu to view examples with `src` or `content` attribute.

value.content: console.log('Hello! This is a Site Script')
value.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
value.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

value.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
value.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

note.description: A note associated with the Coupon. NOTE: this will be deprecated in future versions of the API.

quantity_used.description: The number of times the Coupon has been used.

quantity.description: The number of times the Coupon can be used. If this value if not set, the Coupon can be used an unlimited number of times.

bulk_quantity_per_coupon.description: The number of times each of the autogenerated Coupons can be used. Defaults to allowing unlimited use.

bulk_coupon_code_length.description: The length of the Coupon code. The minimum length is 6.

bulk_quantity.description: The number of unique Coupons to create. Maximum value is 1000.

note.description: A note associated with the Coupon. NOTE: this will be deprecated in future versions of the API.

subtitle.description: Deprecated - Used in legacy themes to display the subtitle of the Course.

description.description: The description of the Course(V2 themes currently don't have that info)

course_card_text.description: Deprecated - use 'description'.* - Used in legacy themes to populate the text for a Course card.

intro_video_youtube.description: Deprecated - Used in legacy themes to designate an intro video from Youtube.

contact_information.description: Deprecated - The contact information of the Course.

duration.description: Deprecated - Used in legacy themes to display the duration of the Course.

banner_image_url.description: Deprecated - use 'course_card_image_url'* - The landing page banner image url of the Course.

updated_at.description: The date/time the Product Publish Request was last updated.

id.description: The ID of the Product as an integer.

created_at.description: The date and time that the Product was created.

productable_id.description: The ID of the Course or Bundle that is represented by the Product.

productable_type.description: The type of item that the Product represents.

price.description: The price of the Product. ** NOTE: price will be deprecated in future versions of the API **

position.description: The position of the Product within the site. Used for ordering.

status.description: The status of the Product. Can be either 'published' or 'draft'.

private.description: A boolean indicating whether the Product is private. When private, a Product cannot be purchased. A user must be enrolled manually.

hidden.description: A boolean indicating whether the Product is hidden. When hidden, the Product will not appear on any site pages. It's landing page will be still be accessible via a link, however.

subscription.description: A boolean indicating whether the Product is a subscription or not.

days_until_expiry.description: If access to a Product can end, this value controls how many days access is granted for from the date of enrollment.

has_certificate.description: A boolean indicating whether the Product has a certificate.

seo_title.description: The SEO title of the Product.

seo_description.description: The SEO description of the Product.

collection_ids.description: The IDs of the Categories to which this Product belongs as integers.

related_product_ids.description: The IDs of any related Products as integers.

description.description: The description of the product (course or bundle)

card_image_url.description: The card image URL for the product.

product_prices.description: The Product Price objects for the Product.

id.description: The ID of the Product Price as an integer.

is_primary.description: A boolean indicating whether the Product Price is the default.

label.description: The description for the Product Price. This value is required when is_primary is false.

price.description: The amount in dollars to be charged.

days_until_expiry.description: The number of days, after purchase, that a student will be enrolled in the course.

pay_button_text.description: This text that is displayed on the Buy Button on the course card and the course landing page.

number_of_payments.description: The number of recurring payments for a Product Price with payment_type of 'payment-plan'.

interval_count.description: The number of intervals between billings. For example, if interval is 'month' and interval_count is '1', the billing frequency is once every month.

trial_interval_count.description: The number of intervals for the trial period. For example, if trial_interval is 'month' and trial_interval_count is '6', the free trial will end (and regular payments will begin) in 6 months.

custom_first_price.description: Students pay this amount for the first payment period of the subscription.

price_name.description: The name of the Product Price. If is_primary is true, returns the name of the product, otherwise returns "{Product name} - {Product Price label}".

currency.description: The three-letter ISO currency code of the Product Price. Must be a supported currency.

id.description: The ID of the Promotion as an integer.

starts_at.description: The date and time when the Promotion begins.

expires_at.description: The date and time when the Promotion ends.

amount.description: The amount of the discount. If 'fixed', must be a dollar value. If 'percentage', must be a number greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100.

coupon_ids.description: The coupon ids related to the promotion.

duration.description: The duration for which the Promotion is applied. ** This value only applies to Promotions set on Products that are set as subscriptions or Payment Plans. **

starts_at.description: The date and time when the Promotion begins.

expires_at.description: The date and time when the Promotion ends.

amount.description: The amount of the discount. If 'fixed', must be a dollar value. If 'percentage', must be a number greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100.

product_ids.description: The Products to apply the Promotion to. If none are specified, the Promotion is applicable to all Products.

coupon_ids.description: The coupon ids related to the promotion.

duration.description: The duration for which the Promotion is applied. ** This value only applies to Promotions set on Products that are set as subscriptions or Payment Plans. **

first_name.description: The first name of the User.

last_name.description: The last name of the User.

roles.description: Any specific roles that the User should be placed in. Possible roles are: affiliate, course_admin, group_analyst, site_admin.

avatar_url.description: The fully-qualified avatar url of the User.

affiliate_code.description: The affiliate code of the User. ** Required only if the User is an affiliate. **

affiliate_commission.description: The affiliate commission % of the User. ** Required only if the User is an affiliate. This should be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100. **

affiliate_commission_type.description: The affiliate payout type, it can be either % (percentage, default) or $ (fixed amount). ** Required only if the User is an affiliate. **

affiliate_payout_email.description: The email of the User. ** Required only if the user is an affiliate. Used to pay the User out. **

custom_profile_fields.description: Custom profile fields for the User.

external_id.description: User External Id given by the provider.

password.description: The password of the User. If not included, the Express Sign In Link becomes activated for the User.

affiliate_commission.description: Required only if the User is an affiliate. This should be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100 if the type is percentage or lower than 9999.99 if is a fixed type.

affiliate_commission_type.description: The affiliate payout type, it can be either % (percentage, default) or $ (fixed amount). Required only if the User is an affiliate.

affiliate_payout_email.description: The email of the User. Required only if the user is an affiliate. Used to pay the User out.

custom_profile_fields.description: Custom profile fields for the User.

skip_custom_fields_validation.description: Option to skip required custom profile fields validation.

send_welcome_email.description: Option to send the Site Welcome email to the User.

external_id.description: Optional identifier of the user in an external system. Typically used in conjunction with Thinkific's single sign-on. For further information on this, please read [this](https://help.thinkific.com/support/solutions/articles/221622-sso-automatically-sign-in-from-your-own-website)

email.description: User's email. This can only be updated by private integrations.

avatar_url.description: The fully-qualified avatar url of the User.

external_source.example: The external source that the user was created from

affiliate_commission.description: Required only if the User is an affiliate. This should be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100 if the type is percentage or lower than 9999.99 if is a fixed type.

affiliate_commission_type.description: The affiliate payout type, it can be either % (percentage, default) or $ (fixed amount). Required only if the User is an affiliate.

affiliate_payout_email.description: The email of the User. Required only if the user is an affiliate. Used to pay the User out.

custom_profile_fields.description: Custom profile fields for the User.

example.error: Access to Apps is not available on your plan. Upgrade to gain access

src.description: A URL that points to where the script is hosted. Required if `content` is not provided. Note the TLD of the src url must match the app's url.

content.description: A string containing HTML/Javascript. Required if `src` is not provided. When providing the script using content, the header HMAC-SHA256-SIGNATURE is also require to be sent. Generate the signature using the app's client secret and the value.
content.example: console.log('Hello! This is a Site Script')

name.description: A short and user-friendly string to identify the script.

description.description: A user-friendly explanation of the script's purpose and what it does.
description.example: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

page_scopes.description:
An array of page and domain identifiers that the Site Script should be injected onto. `page_scopes` can contain identifiers that are groupings of pages and/or the pages themselves.

The majority of the page identifiers correspond to Liquid pages. For more details, take a look at our [Liquid API docs](https://developers.thinkific.com/themes/liquid-api/pages/).

Groupings and Page Identifiers:

| Page Grouping | Page Identifiers Included |
| ------- | --------|
| landing_pages   | home_landing_page, course_landing_page, collections_landing_page, bundle_landing_page, coming_soon_page, page_template (used for custom pages)   |
| checkout   | checkout_thankyou_page   |
| learning_experience   | student_dashboard, course_player   |
| all   | all page identifiers listed above   |

content.description: A string containing HTML/Javascript. Required if `src` is not provided.
content.example: console.log('Hello! This is a Site Script')

src.description: A URL that points to where the script is hosted. Required if `content` is not provided.

name.description: A short and user-friendly string to identify the script.

description.description: A user-friendly explanation of the script's purpose and what it does.
description.example: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

page_scopes.description:
An array of page and domain identifiers that the Site Script should be injected onto. `page_scopes` can contain identifiers that are groupings of pages and/or the pages themselves.

The majority of the page identifiers correspond to Liquid pages. For more details, take a look at our [Liquid API docs](https://developers.thinkific.com/themes/liquid-api/pages/).

Groupings and Page Identifiers:

| Page Grouping | Page Identifiers Included |
| ------- | --------|
| landing_pages   | home_landing_page, course_landing_page, collections_landing_page, bundle_landing_page, coming_soon_page, page_template (used for custom pages)   |
| checkout   | checkout_thankyou_page   |
| learning_experience   | student_dashboard, course_player   |
| all   | all page identifiers listed above   |

example.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
example.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

example.content: console.log('Hello! This is a Site Script')
example.name: MyApp's Tracking Script
example.description: MyApp's Tracking Script runs on your site's landing pages and tracks information about your user's visits. MyApp uses this data in our reporting tools so you can better understand your customers.

activated_at.description: The date/time at which the Enrollment is to be activated. If not provided, the Enrollment will only provide access to free preview content within the Courses. Provide full access to courses by setting this value to the current date/time.

expiry_date.description: The date/time at which the Enrollment should be expired. If not provided, the Enrollment does not expire.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Describes the purpose of the script. Accepted values are: functional, analytics, marketing

DiscountType.title: DiscountType
DiscountType.description: The type of discount. Must be either 'fixed' or 'percentage'.

Interval.title: Interval
Interval.description: The billing frequency. Must be one of 'month' or 'year'.

LoadMethod.title: LoadMethod
LoadMethod.description: How the Site Script will be loaded into the page. Accepted values are: async, defer, and default

Location.title: Location
Location.description: Where in the HTML the script should be injected. Accepted values are: head or footer

PaymentType.title: PaymentType
PaymentType.description: The type of payment. Must be one of 'free', 'one-time', 'subscription', or 'payment-plan'.

Provider.title: Provider
Provider.description: Authentication provider associated with the user.

Provider1.title: Provider1
Provider1.description: When using Thinkific single sign-on and providing an external_id, specify the provider type to distinguish which single sign-on type the user should be associated with.

provider2.title: provider2
provider2.description: Provider that creates the user and with which the External Id is associated.

TrialInterval.title: TrialInterval
TrialInterval.description: The interval for the trial period. Must be one of 'day' or 'month'.

tags.name: External Orders
tags.description: Please note that any External Orders created through the API do not appear on the orders report or dashboard in your Thinkific site. Using the External Orders endpoints will simply store the information in our database.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about Thinkifc's API
